reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst experience we had in New Zealand, the staff is very rude, the place is not maintained and the bathrooms and the kitchen are very dirty, the cabins have only a bed inside and not even a socket to recharge devices, the nights are noisy and we didn't even find the bathtub they advertised. Overall, a place I wouldn't recommend to anyone!
reviews.title: Poor!

reviews.text: Brilliant location and spotlessly clean cabins, but be sure to take advantage of the extra duvets if you're not staying in the middle of summer as it gets pretty chilly at night!
reviews.title: Perfect spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great communal areas, particularly the outside kitchen / dining space. My only quibble would be that there aren't enough showers, meaning long waits at busy times.
reviews.title: Couldnt imagine a better place to stay before and after the Abel Tasman tramp

reviews.text: We really were wowed when we came to The Barn, we weren't expecting it to be firstly, so big, and secondly, so nice.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The welcome from the new owners was lovely and we were so happy with the facilities. They really specialise in comfort at The Barn. The dining room is both indoor and outdoor, the kitchen is well stocked, the showers are hot and powerful, the TV room is nice and relaxing with loads of DVDs and you can just sit just about anywhere and have an awesome view of the start of the tremendous Abel Tasman National Park.
reviews.title: Good campsite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this place by looking on the map for accommodation closest to the final section of the Abel Tasman NP trail. Closer than this isn't possible, I think. At the time of out visit, part of the hostel area was under renovation, it was possible to use only the common areas (as kitchen, dining room, bathroom, internet). Vicariously rooms were organized in large tents. However, the location is so good that for young guests this wasn't problem. This HP provide car parking during trips to Abel Tasman.
reviews.title: Close to Abel Tasman trail.

reviews.text: We tried our first night in the small single cabins - for some reason our cabin smelt really bad (i think simply due to limited ventilaion). However we told the manager who swiftly moved us to a really nice double bed room in the main lodge. This room was fantastic, clean and the Ritz in comparison to the cabins.
reviews.title: Breathtaking location

reviews.text: The location is fab, just monutes from amazing walks in the NP. If youre lucky you may see killer whales out in the sea oposite the coast!!!
reviews.title: Simple, clean, great location...

reviews.text: The barn was a great, affordable place to stay... I stayed in a cabin, which was very simple, but really neat and clean. The indoor/outdoor cooking area was helpful and made meal time really easy. The location was perfect since it was steps away from the park, and the views at the barn were really nice. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would def. stay here again!
reviews.title: Greatest campground ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Barn campground at the start of the Abel Tasman Track is so perfect in so many ways. Great location. Stunning scenery. Peaceful but not boring. Truly close walk to restaurant or awesome burger bar, outdoor art gallery, swimming river, beach, horse riding, the track. Fresh eggs and fruit/vege to buy. Outdoor private baths. Large deck and fire place. Hot Water - never ever runs out. Incredible staff full of local knowledge and able to help with any bookings.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Good campsite. But make sure you're in time for a campsite (it gets crowded). As the 'chalets/rooms/dunnowhattacallthem' are not worth you money. So be in time with your booking.
reviews.title: Go for the campsites!!

reviews.text: But it's a great place right at the start of the Abel Tasman Track and far away from the touristy Marahau 'citycenter'. With that it is a great(!) hub into Abel Tasman.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: our experience was very disappointing. The management was extremely unprofessional and the service we received was rude. We arrived just before the office closed and we got told from the lady at the reception to go to tent 2. However around 10pm a family of 6 arrived to the camp site and were told to the same tent number. The receptionist (probably the owner) came in the tent yelling at us that we were having some sort of party at the tent and we were not meant to be in this tent (we were watching a movie on a laptop). She was extremely rude and disrespectful and calling us arragant to the family outside the tent. We never received an apologize from the management even after we had apologized for misunderstanding. For this reason I would never stay in this place again as there are other lovely camp sites in Marahau. The prices are also over priced.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited The Barn as part of an organised trip and stayed there two nights, sharing one of the twin bedded cabins. The accommodation was very clean, the beds were very comfortable and the kitchen a good size. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, and thought they were very conscientious. There were only three showers, but there were generally no queues.
reviews.title: You Get What You see

reviews.text: The Barn is located just a few minutes walk from the national park, so could not be better located. Recommended.
reviews.title: GREATEST CAMPING EXPERIENCE!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved The Barn, it was right at the beginning of the the Abel Tasman track so perfect if you only want to walk a little of the track. We stayed for two nights, got up early on our second day and started our one day trek, walking to Anchorage Bay and back. A much cheaper option for those of you who do not want to pay a fortune for the water taxis.
reviews.title: Definitely Recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Barn is really spread out so you don't ever feel like it's too busy. There are two very clean kitchens so plenty of space for everyone when it comes to meal times, the social areas are fantastic which makes it really easy to meet people. They have a lovely outside area with an open fire and a pool table. The views around the Barn are gorgeous, most of the cabins face the sea and the night sky is just stunning as there is practically no light pollution.
reviews.title: So many stars!!

reviews.text: Cabins are comfortable, clean and there is plenty of space for two people, plus bags. At $60 a night I also thought they were well priced considering their location.
reviews.title: Consistently the best camping in Marahau

reviews.text: There is a bar about 15 mins walk away which does a good happy hour from 4 - 6pm and another at the top of the street (2 mins walk), no happy hour there though.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: If you do choose to stay here make sure you take your food with you as there are no shops nearby (20 minute drive to nearest town).
reviews.title: Interesting accommodation!
